entry.title: Welcome
entry.summary: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.
entry.content:
Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.

Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory.

Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml.

The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as:

  • 2019-05-30-welcome.md
  • 2019-05-30-welcome/index.md

A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images:

The blog supports tags as well!

And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

entry.title: MDX Blog Post
entry.content:
Blog support​

Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX.

The second title​

tip

Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts.

<button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button>

entry.title: Long Blog Post
entry.summary: This is the summary of a very long blog post,
entry.content:
This is the summary of a very long blog post,

Use a <!-- truncate --> comment to limit blog post size in the list view.

entry.title: First Blog Post
entry.summary: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Pellentesque elementum dignissim ultricies. Fusce rhoncus ipsum tempor eros aliquam consequat. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
entry.content:
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Pellentesque elementum dignissim ultricies. Fusce rhoncus ipsum tempor eros aliquam consequat. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet

this is a R hiligthing test​

#####################################################################
#  License      : This source code is licensed under the MIT license.
#  Author(s)    : FHS-BAP data core (QT).
#  Release date : TBA
#  Description  : Get the framid from IDTYPE and ID in FHS Data. 
#  Usage        : library(dplyr)
#               : data <- data %>%
#               :     dplyr::mutate(framid = get_framid(idtype, id)
#####################################################################

get_framid <- function(idtype, id) {
    if (!((length(idtype) == 1 & length(id) >= 1) | 
          (length(idtype) ==     length(id)     ))) 
         stop("Error: the length of idtype and id did not match!")
    
    # mapping framid to idtype
    id_matrix <- data.frame(
        idtype        = c(0, 1, 2, 3, 7, 72), 
        adjust_factor = c(0, 80000, 20000, 30000, 700000, 720000)
    )
    
    x <- merge(data.frame(idtype = idtype, id = id), 
               id_matrix, by = "idtype", all.x = TRUE)
    return(x$id + x$adjust_factor)
}

this is a jsx hiligthing test​

#####################################################################
#  License      : This source code is licensed under the MIT license.
#  Author(s)    : FHS-BAP data core (QT).
#  Release date : TBA
#  Description  : Get the framid from IDTYPE and ID in FHS Data. 
#  Usage        : library(dplyr)
#               : data <- data %>%
#               :     dplyr::mutate(framid = get_framid(idtype, id)
#####################################################################

get_framid <- function(idtype, id) {
    if (!((length(idtype) == 1 & length(id) >= 1) | 
          (length(idtype) ==     length(id)     ))) 
         stop("Error: the length of idtype and id did not match!")
    
    # mapping framid to idtype
    id_matrix <- data.frame(
        idtype        = c(0, 1, 2, 3, 7, 72), 
        adjust_factor = c(0, 80000, 20000, 30000, 700000, 720000)
    )
    
    x <- merge(data.frame(idtype = idtype, id = id), 
               id_matrix, by = "idtype", all.x = TRUE)
    return(x$id + x$adjust_factor)
}

this is a python hiligthing test​

#####################################################################
#  License      : This source code is licensed under the MIT license.
#  Author(s)    : FHS-BAP data core (QT).
#  Release date : TBA
#  Description  : Get the framid from IDTYPE and ID in FHS Data. 
#  Usage        : library(dplyr)
#               : data <- data %>%
#               :     dplyr::mutate(framid = get_framid(idtype, id)
#####################################################################

get_framid <- function(idtype, id) {
    if (!((length(idtype) == 1 & length(id) >= 1) | 
          (length(idtype) ==     length(id)     ))) 
         stop("Error: the length of idtype and id did not match!")
    
    # mapping framid to idtype
    id_matrix <- data.frame(
        idtype        = c(0, 1, 2, 3, 7, 72), 
        adjust_factor = c(0, 80000, 20000, 30000, 700000, 720000)
    )
    
    x <- merge(data.frame(idtype = idtype, id = id), 
               id_matrix, by = "idtype", all.x = TRUE)
    return(x$id + x$adjust_factor)
}

this is a sas hiligthing test​

#####################################################################
#  License      : This source code is licensed under the MIT license.
#  Author(s)    : FHS-BAP data core (QT).
#  Release date : TBA
#  Description  : Get the framid from IDTYPE and ID in FHS Data. 
#  Usage        : library(dplyr)
#               : data <- data %>%
#               :     dplyr::mutate(framid = get_framid(idtype, id)
#####################################################################

get_framid <- function(idtype, id) {
    if (!((length(idtype) == 1 & length(id) >= 1) | 
          (length(idtype) ==     length(id)     ))) 
         stop("Error: the length of idtype and id did not match!")
    
    # mapping framid to idtype
    id_matrix <- data.frame(
        idtype        = c(0, 1, 2, 3, 7, 72), 
        adjust_factor = c(0, 80000, 20000, 30000, 700000, 720000)
    )
    
    x <- merge(data.frame(idtype = idtype, id = id), 
               id_matrix, by = "idtype", all.x = TRUE)
    return(x$id + x$adjust_factor)
}

this is a bash hiligthing test​

#####################################################################
#  License      : This source code is licensed under the MIT license.
#  Author(s)    : FHS-BAP data core (QT).
#  Release date : TBA
#  Description  : Get the framid from IDTYPE and ID in FHS Data. 
#  Usage        : library(dplyr)
#               : data <- data %>%
#               :     dplyr::mutate(framid = get_framid(idtype, id)
#####################################################################

sudo apt update
mkdir website
cd website
yarn start --port 4000
